content: I'll be dropping notes in here while I prepare a very last minute hackmd for Friday's meeting
Agenda (TBD): https://hackmd.io/UkwCqn0CRSGo1nPH__yJQA
for ease of reference: https://zoom.us/j/96764377915

A few of us discussed many of these RFCs about 2 months ago and I don't think much has changed in that time. I'll leave a link in case anyone is interested in looking at that discussion: https://hackmd.io/Z2nbt_FdRCWlypaPQ_iW1g

Here is the list being discussed:
RFC PR #2951: “Linking modifiers for native libraries”
RFC PR #2841: “-C export executable symbols”
RFC PR #2803: “Target tier policy”
RFC PR #2794: “Environment variable sandboxing”
RFC PR #2777: “Scope prints in diagnostics”
RFC PR #2400: “Zero Page Optimization”
RFC PR #2154: “Debuginfo-based panic locations”
oh, this is a zoom call, I missed that...
@T-compiler/meeting steering meeting starting soon, it is taking place on zoom
fyi, I will join in 15 or so minutes
looking at rfc#2951 now
decision: just merge
looking at rfc#2841 now
decision: niko will check off all the lang team member checkboxes. eddyb will look at the RFC and maybe check off a box
looking at rfc#2803
decision: people should look at this, but we do nothing on it today
looking at rfc#2794 now
decision: FCP merge
looking at rfc#2777 now
decision: recommend to author to convert to MCP, then close the RFC.
looking at rfc#2400 now
decision: post a comment saying that there are many open questions, and those questions are (or should be) tracked on the unsafe-code-guidelines repository. Then close the RFC
looking at rfc#2154 now
decision: post a comment encouraging an MCP for just the support for external debuginfo

(and then close this RFC, with suggestion that there could be independent RFCs focusing on the policy questions around 1. cargo release defaults and 2. panic UI i.e. whether to include full backtrace w/o RUST_BACKTRACE=1)
